igraphlite 1.0.1
  • Reference

The simple interface for graph isomorphism

Source: R/isomorphism.R
isomorphic.Rd

In simple terms, two graphs are isomorphic if they become indistinguishable from each other once their vertex labels are removed.

Usage

isomorphic(graph1, graph2)

subisomorphic(graph1, graph2)

Source

https://igraph.org/c/html/latest/igraph-Isomorphism.html#isomorphism-simple-interface

Arguments

graph1, graph2

Two igraph_ptr objects to compare.

Value

A logical value.

subisomorphic() returns TRUE if graph2 is isomorphic to a subgraph of graph1.

See also

is_same_graph().

Examples

g1 = graph_create(c(1L, 2L, 1L, 3L), directed = FALSE)
g2 = graph_create(c(3L, 2L, 3L, 1L), directed = FALSE)
isomorphic(g1, g2)
#> [1] TRUE
subisomorphic(g1, g2)
#> [1] TRUE

g3 = graph_create(c(1L, 2L, 1L, 3L, 3L, 4L), directed = FALSE)
subisomorphic(g3, g1)
#> [1] TRUE
subisomorphic(g1, g3)
#> [1] FALSE
